characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.

characters.name: Di-Jun Wang
characters.description1: The current president of Zheng Fa. An attempt was made on his life as he gave a speech at an event held in his honor.

characters.name: Tabby Lloyd
characters.description1: A journalist who attended the president's speech hoping to snap up a scoop.

characters.name: Kay Faraday
characters.description1: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.

characters.name: John Doe → Shelly de Killer
characters.description1: An ice cream seller who's currently my prime suspect. He certainly ticks all the right boxes...
characters.description2: A professional assassin who appears to have some kind of connection to the victim.
characters.description3: A professional assassin who attempted to kill the president two days ago. Rook managed to intercept him then, and injure his left arm.

characters.name: Bronco Knight
characters.description1: Second-in-command of the president's security detail. Appears to be something of a specialist when it comes to handling firearms.
characters.description2: Second-in-command of the president's security detail. An injury means that he is unable to turn his head to his right.

characters.name: Bastian Rook
characters.description1: The victim. He was the leader of the president's security detail, and appears to have died in the line of duty.

evidences.name: Prosecutor's Badge
evidences.description1: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.

evidences.name: Newspaper Article
evidences.description1: A special report about President Di-Jun Wang. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Steel Samurai Balloon
evidences.description1: Started out floating to the right of the lakeside stage, but has since been popped.

evidences.name: Ms. Lloyd's Tape
evidences.description1: A recording of the president's speech. Two gunshots can clearly be heard.

evidences.name: Bullet Trajectory
evidences.description1: Extrapolations from bullet trajectories suggest that the two shots were fired from the left side of the spectator area.
evidences.description2: Extrapolations from bullet trajectories suggest that Knight fired the shots that popped the balloon.

evidences.name: Security Plan
evidences.description1: A diagram of the president's security arrangements. Almost certainly classified.
evidences.description2: A diagram of the president's security arrangements, which were changed only yesterday.

evidences.name: Revolver → Assassin's Revolver → Mr. Knight's Revolver
evidences.description1: Found in a trash can on the left side of the spectator area. Fitted with a laser sight. Two spent bullets.
evidences.description2: Found in a trash can on the left side of the spectator area. Fitted with a laser sight. Two spent bullets. Used in the attempt.
evidences.description3: Found in a trash can on the left side of the spectator area. Two spent bullets. Same model as the victim's.
evidences.description4: Switched for the one found in the spectator area. Bullet markings match those of the bullet fired in the incident

evidences.name: Kay's Photograph → Kay's Photographs
evidences.description1: A photograph of the president at the exact moment the incident occurred. Click here for details.
evidences.description2: Three photographs taken before, during and after the shooting.

evidences.name: Red Raincoat
evidences.description1: Seemingly discarded by the person in the red hood. Found under the Samurai Dog stand.
evidences.description2: Missing a button from the right sleeve. Its wearer has an injury on the left side of their body.
evidences.description3: There's blood on the inside. The person who was wearing it must have an injured left arm.

evidences.name: Security Monitors
evidences.description1: Screens showing footage from in and around the aircraft. One monitor is missing.

evidences.name: Bulletproof Attaché Case
evidences.description1: Designed to provide protection from gunfire. Knight and Rook were each issued one.

evidences.name: Crime Scene Notes
evidences.description1: The victim bled to death from a gunshot wound to the torso. The bullet passed clean through his body.

evidences.name: Bulletproof Vest
evidences.description1: Stopped the bullet that passed through the victim. The bullet itself was crushed flat by the impact.
evidences.description2: A prop used in the staged assassination attempt. The flattened bullet was also planted ahead of time.

evidences.name: Calling Card
evidences.description1: Left behind by the assassin Shelly de Killer when he made his escape. Adorned with his distinctive seashell emblem.

evidences.name: Bloody Bullet
evidences.description1: Found in a security monitor. This seems to be the bullet that killed Rook.
